[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Project ZNIX specifies requirements for an object-based, application-independent retrieval framework.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Project ZNIX facilitates efficient information management with hierarchical organization and user-defined logic.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Project ZNIX integrates with client processes and third-party applications via APIs and proxies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Project ZNIX includes a browser-like GUI for managing entities.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Project ZNIX runs on systems with Intel Core i3/AMD Ryzen 3 processors.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Project ZNIX is compatible with tools like Outlook and web browsers for capturing data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Project ZNIX operates as a standalone application without networking needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Project ZNIX utilizes resources efficiently, capped at 40MB RAM.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Project ZNIX supports managing, capturing, and archiving hierarchical data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Project ZNIX is customizable for diverse user and organizational needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Project ZNIX interoperates with external APIs for added functionality.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Project ZNIX centralizes storage, organizes hierarchically, and ensures efficient retrieval.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Project ZNIX is designed for researchers, managers, and end-users with basic technical skills.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Project ZNIX supports single-user mode and select operating systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Project ZNIX requires compatibility with Java 17+ and supported operating systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Entity: Core object managed independently within the framework.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall provide APIs for managing entities and relationships.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The GUI shall allow users to browse, query, and manage hierarchies.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall automate categorization and archiving of information (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow hierarchical visualization of relationships (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The GUI shall mimic familiar layouts for ease of use (e.g., Windows Explorer).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall initialize within 10 seconds on supported hardware.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall manage 10,000 entities with no performance degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store relationships persistently.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall support backup and restore operations.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with open standards for interoperability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 10646 for character encoding.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall operate with 99.9% reliability under defined conditions.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: User actions shall receive feedback within 1 second (REQ-USAB-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit tests validate APIs, GUI responsiveness, and system performance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, help guides, and example implementations.
[SEC] 5. References: ZNIX Technical Manual, ISO Documentation, and GNU Licensing.
